org.opentcs.util.eventsystem

Class EventBuffer<E extends Event>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentcs.util.eventsystem.EventBuffer<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - The actual event implementation.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventListener<E>

    public class EventBuffer<E extends Event>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventListener<E>
    Stores events and keeps them until a client fetches them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      EventBuffer(EventFilter<E> eventFilter)
      Creates a new EventBuffer.

      • processEvent

        public void processEvent(E event)

        Specified by:
        processEvent in interface EventListener<E extends Event>
        Parameters:

      • getEvents

        public java.util.List<E> getEvents(long timeout)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a list of events that are currently stored in this buffer and clears the buffer. If the buffer is currently empty, block until an event arrives, or for the specified amount of time to pass, whichever occurs first.
        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of time (in ms) to wait for an event to arrive. Must be at least 0 (in which case this method will return immediately, without waiting for an event to arrive).
        Returns:
        A list of events that are currently stored in this buffer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If timeout is less than 0.

      • hasWaitingClient

        public boolean hasWaitingClient()
        Checks whether a client is currently waiting for events arriving in this buffer.
        Returns:
        true if a client is currently waiting, else false.

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(EventFilter<E> eventFilter)
        Sets this buffer's event filter.
        Parameters:
        eventFilter - This buffer's new event filter.
